    Using the Senaps API from R with RSenaps

    Bangyou Zheng

    Alex Whan

    2021-08-31

    using-rsenaps.Rmd

    RSenaps is used to communicate with Senaps platform.

    Getting started

    Before you can start to use RSenaps, you have to create an account on Senaps. There are two ways to authenticate with Senaps.

    • Username and password
    • APIKEY

    You can follow the instruction to securely store secrets in R. We suggest you to use APIKEY for authentication as security season and store the credentials in the .Renviron file as the environment variable.

    Before you start my API call in RSenaps, senaps_options has to be called to setup up credentials if you store your username, password or apikey in the .Renviron file.

    # Use username and password
senaps_options(username = Sys.getenv("SENAPS_USERNAME"),
               password = Sys.getenv("SENAPS_PASSWORD"))

# Use APIKEY
senaps_options(apikey = Sys.getenv("SENAPS_APIKEY"))

    The credentials are stored in the sessions using settings packages and used in the further API call.
